name: Antennas
description: Sector template for antenna patents including antenna elements, arrays, integration, and packaging for wireless systems.
contextDescription: Antenna patents cover the design, integration, and packaging of antennas for wireless communication. Key areas include antenna elements (patch, dipole, slot), antenna arrays, phased arrays, MIMO antennas, and antenna-in-package (AiP) integration. Targets include mobile device OEMs, chipset vendors, and infrastructure equipment manufacturers.
scoringGuidance: Antenna-in-Package (AiP) patents are high value for 5G mmWave devices.
Multi-band antennas that cover 4G/5G/WiFi bands are valuable for device miniaturization.
Phased array patents target 5G beamforming applications.
Low-profile and conformal antenna patents address wearables and IoT form factors.
Patents addressing antenna-body interaction (SAR, hand effect) target mobile device certification.

questions.question: What type of antenna does this patent cover? Score 1-3 for basic elements (dipole, monopole), 4-6 for advanced elements (patch, slot, PIFA), 7-10 for arrays or integrated solutions.
questions.reasoningPrompt: Identify antenna type: dipole, patch, slot, PIFA, phased array, AiP.

questions.question: What is the level of antenna integration? Score 1-3 for discrete antenna, 4-6 for module integration, 7-10 for antenna-in-package (AiP) or system-in-package (SiP).
questions.reasoningPrompt: High integration is valuable for 5G mmWave. Assess packaging and integration level.

questions.question: What frequency bands does this antenna cover? Score 1-3 for single band, 4-6 for multi-band (2-3 bands), 7-10 for wideband or many-band (4+ bands, mmWave).
questions.reasoningPrompt: Modern devices need multi-band support. Identify frequency bands: sub-6GHz, mmWave, WiFi.

questions.question: Does this patent address form factor challenges? Score 1-3 for standard size, 4-6 for compact/low-profile, 7-10 for conformal, flexible, or miniaturized.
questions.reasoningPrompt: Form factor is critical for wearables, IoT, and thin devices. Assess size innovation.

questions.question: What performance aspects does this patent improve? Consider: gain, efficiency, bandwidth, isolation, SAR compliance, beam steering.
questions.reasoningPrompt: Identify performance metrics improved and their significance for target applications.
